defineDexSupport(address,bool).details: Will revert with `ZeroAddress` if the zero address if given

params._support: Whether the Companion should support swaps with the given DEX

setTokensWithApprovalIssues(address[],bo.details: Will revert with `InvalidTokenApprovalParams` if the length of the given arrays differ

params._hasIssue: Wether they have issues or not

swapForCaller(address[],(uint8,uint8)[],.details: Will revert: With RewardNotEnough if the minimum output is not met With ToProvideIsTooMuch if the hub swap requires more than the given maximum input

params._deadline: Deadline when the swap becomes invalid
params._maximumInput: The maximum amount of tokens to provide as part of the swap
params._minimumOutput: The minimum amount of tokens to receive as part of the swap
params._recipient: Address that will receive all the tokens from the swap
params._tokens: The tokens involved in the swap

returns._swapInfo: The information about the executed swap

params._callsToDex: The bytes to send to the DEX to execute swaps
params._deadline: Deadline when the swap becomes invalid
params._dex: The DEX that will be used in the swap
params._doDexSwapsIncludeTransferToHub: Some DEXes support swap & transfer, which would be cheaper in terms of gas If this feature is used, then the flag should be true
params._leftoverRecipient: Address that will receive all unspent tokens
params._tokens: The tokens involved in the swap
params._tokensProxy: The spender of the tokens (could be different from the dex)

returns._0: The information about the executed swap

params._callsToDex: The bytes to send to the DEX to execute swaps
params._deadline: Deadline when the swap becomes invalid
params._dex: The DEX that will be used in the swap
params._doDexSwapsIncludeTransferToHub: Some DEXes support swap & transfer, which would be cheaper in terms of gas If this feature is used, then the flag should be true
params._leftoverRecipient: Address that will receive `reward` unspent tokens
params._tokens: The tokens involved in the swap
params._tokensProxy: The spender of the tokens (could be different from the dex)

returns._0: The information about the executed swap

CallToDexFailed().notice: Thrown when a call to the given DEX fails

CallbackNotCalledByHub().notice: Thrown when callback is not called by the hub

InvalidTokenApprovalParams().notice: Thrown when the given parameters are invalid

RewardNotEnough().notice: Thrown when the reward is less that the specified minimum

SwapNotInitiatedByCompanion().notice: Thrown when swap was not initiated by the companion

ToProvideIsTooMuch().notice: Thrown when the amount to provide is more than the specified maximum

UnauthorizedCaller().notice: Thrown when a user tries operate on a position that they don't have access to

UnexpectedSwapPlan().notice: Thrown when the callback is executed with an unexpected swap plan

UnsupportedDex().notice: Thrown when a swap is executed with a DEX that is not supported

ZeroAddress().notice: Thrown when one of the parameters is a zero address

TokenWithApprovalIssuesSet(address[],boo.notice: Emitted when tokens with approval issues are set

defineDexSupport(address,bool).notice: Defines whether a specific DEX will be supported for swaps

isDexSupported(address).notice: Returns whether the given DEX can be used for swaps for not

setTokensWithApprovalIssues(address[],bo.notice: Sets whether specific addresses have issues with approvals, like USDT

swapForCaller(address[],(uint8,uint8)[],.notice: Executes a swap for the caller, by sending them the reward, and taking from them the needed tokens

swapWithDex(address,address,address[],(u.notice: Executes a swap with the given DEX, and sends all unspent tokens to the given recipient

swapWithDexAndShareLeftoverWithHub(addre.notice: Executes a swap with the given DEX and sends all `reward` unspent tokens to the given recipient. All positive slippage for tokens that need to be returned to the hub is also sent to the hub

tokenHasApprovalIssue(address).notice: Returns whether the given address has issues with approvals, like USDT

wToken().notice: Returns the address of the wrapped token
